page.title: 18Sparkbrook 1885-1985 B'ham
page.content: In 1885 Sparkbrook was a quiet and rich area. It was clean with large houses, some farms and no factories or industry. The River Spark was an open brook going from east to west and joining the River Cole. Today Sparkbrook is built up, with a main road and part of the inner ring road going past our school. Several of the children live in shops. Joanna's dad has a Chip shop, Sharon's dad has an Off-Licence, Taruna's dad keeps the Post Office whilst Imran's and Najma's famillies have Grocery Stores. The river is culverted and the farms have had houses built on them. The houses are small terraces. In 1900 our school was built on Hind's Farm. Today Sparkbrook is busy with shops, cars, lorries, buses and lots of people. In 1885 only horses, carts and some new trams ran on the cobbled roads.
